intro: Phyllanthus leucochlamys, commonly known as the white-veined phyllanthus, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with prominent white veins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. Phyllanthus leucochlamys is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
